title: Simulation-Based Learning Curriculum for Pediatric Emergency Medicine Fellowship

context.prior_knowledge: Basic medical knowledge and clinical practice experience
context.additional_context: Hybrid educational environment integrating digital simulation equipment with real clinical scenarios.

learning_goals: Perform core procedures (e.g., endotracheal intubation, chest decompression) with over 80% accuracy in pediatric emergency scenarios
Achieve a simulation evaluation score of 4 or higher (out of 5) by applying multidisciplinary team-based crisis management protocols
Enhance ability to apply the ABCDE approach and prioritize treatment in complex trauma patient simulations
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
